content.value: System monitoring means checking CPU, memory, disk, and running processes to understand system performance and detect problems.
Monitoring helps identify why a system is slow, which process is using resources, and if any application or service is misbehaving.

value: Improved top with colors and navigation (if installed)
Reports CPU, memory, and system processes efficiently

content.value: If the system is slow: check CPU (top) → memory (free -h) → disk (df -h).

steps: Run top to view live CPU/memory usage and active processes.
Use htop (if installed) for a cleaner, interactive display.
Check memory usage with free -h to see RAM breakdown.
Check disk space with df -h to avoid system slowdowns.
Use iostat to see if storage devices are overloaded.
